member.param: The RPC request.
The call settings to apply to this specific call, overriding defaults where necessary.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ApiCall`2.WithExceptionCustomizer(System.Func{Grpc.Core.RpcException,Grpc.Core.RpcException})
member.summary: Construct a new that applies an exception customizer to both the synchronous and asynchronous calls.
member.remarks: will be passed any exception that is thrown by the underlying API call. If it returns null, the original exception is retained and passed on. Otherwise, the returned exception is thrown in place of the original one.
member.param: The exception customizer to apply. Must not be null.
member.returns: A new with the exception customizer applied.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings
member.summary: Backoff settings used within to implement exponential backoff.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings.Delay
member.summary: The initial delay, either for the first retry or as the initial RPC timeout.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings.MaxDelay
member.summary: The maximum delay to use. If the increasing delay due to the delay multiplier exceeds this, this maximum is used instead.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings.DelayMultiplier
member.summary: The multiplier to apply to the delay on each iteration; must be greater than or equal to 1.0.

remarks.para: As an example, a multiplier of 2.0 with a delay of 0.1s on an RPC which fails three times before succeeding would lead to an initial delay between the first response and the second request of 0.1s; a delay between the second response and the third request of 0.2s, and a delay between the third response and the fourth request.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance with the specified settings.
member.param: The initial delay, either for the first retry or as the initial RPC timeout.
The maximum delay to use. If the increasing delay due to the delay multiplier exceeds this, this maximum is used instead.
The multiplier to apply to the delay on each iteration; must be greater than or equal to 1.0. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings.NextDelay(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Works out the next delay from the current one, based on the multiplier and maximum.
member.param: The current delay to use as a basis for the next one.
member.returns: The next delay to use, which is always at least and at most .

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2
member.summary: Base class for bidirectional streaming RPC methods.
member.typeparam: RPC request type
RPC response type

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2.GrpcCall
member.summary: The underlying gRPC duplex streaming call. Warning: DO NOT USE GrpcCall.RequestStream at all if using , , , or . Doing so will cause conflict with the write-buffer used within the [Try]WriteAsync methods.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2.TryWriteAsync(`0)
member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called. The same write options will be used as for the previous message.
member.param: The message to write.
member.returns: null if the message queue is full or the stream has already been completed; otherwise, a which will complete when the message has been written to the stream.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2.WriteAsync(`0)
member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called. The same write options will be used as for the previous message.
member.param: The message to write.
member.exception: There isn't enough space left in the buffer, or has already been called.
member.returns: A which will complete when the message has been written to the stream.

member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called.
member.param: The message to write.
The write options to use for this message.
member.returns: null if the message queue is full or the stream has already been completed.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2.WriteAsync(`0,Grpc.Core.WriteOptions)
member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called.
member.param: The message to write.
The write options to use for this message.
member.exception: There isn't enough space left in the buffer, or has already been called.
member.returns: A which will complete when the message has been written to the stream.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2.TryWriteCompleteAsync
member.returns: A which will complete when the stream has finished being completed; or null if this method has already been called.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2.WriteCompleteAsync
member.summary: Completes the stream when all buffered messages have been sent. This method can only be called once, and further messages cannot be written after it has been called.
member.exception: This method has already been called.
member.returns: A which will complete when the stream has finished being completed.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingBase`2.ResponseStream
member.summary: Async stream to read streaming responses.

member.summary: Settings for bidirectional streaming.

member.summary: Configure settings for bidirectional streaming.
member.param: The capacity of the write buffer.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BidirectionalStreamingSettings.BufferedClientWriterCapacity
member.summary: The capacity of the write buffer, that locally buffers streaming requests before they are sent to the server.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1
member.summary: A wrapper around which removes the "one write at a time" restriction by buffering messages (and the completion signal) up to a given capacity.
member.typeparam: The type of message in the stream.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1._queue
member.summary: Queue of requests. If this is non-empty, there's at least one request in-flight, which is always the head of the queue.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.Capacity
member.summary: The capacity of the writer.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.BufferedWriteCount
member.summary: The number of write calls that have been buffered.
member.remarks: The value of this property may change due to activity from other threads. It should only be used for testing and similar scenarios where the system state is well understood.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.#ctor(Grpc.Core.IClientStreamWriter{`0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs an instance which writes to the specified writer, and with the given capacity.
member.param: The writer to delegate to.
The maximum number of messages to buffer.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.TryWriteAsync(`0)
member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called. The same write options will be used as for the previous message.
member.param: The message to write.
member.returns: null if the message queue is full or the stream has already been completed; otherwise, a which will complete when the message has been written to the stream.

member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called.
member.param: The message to write.
The write options to use for this message.
member.returns: null if the message queue is full or the stream has already been completed.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.WriteAsync(`0)
member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called. The same write options will be used as for the previous message.
member.param: The message to write.
member.exception: There isn't enough space left in the buffer, or the stream has been completed.
member.returns: A which will complete when the message has been written to the stream.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.WriteAsync(`0,Grpc.Core.WriteOptions)
member.summary: Writes a message to the stream, if there is enough space in the buffer and hasn't already been called.
member.param: The message to write.
The write options to use for this message.
member.exception: There isn't enough space left in the buffer, or has already been called.
member.returns: A which will complete when the message has been written to the stream.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.HandleWriteComplete(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: One of the writes completes - possibly successfully, possibly not. On success, we start the next write (or complete) sending if there is one. On failure, we propagate the result of this task to all other tasks. Those will in turn trigger further calls to this method, but by that time we'll have retained the failed task so we can just exit quickly.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.ValidateStateForWrite(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates that we can write to the stream, optionally throwing if there's an error. This is basically to avoid a big chunk of code appearing in WriteAsyncImpl.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.TryWriteCompleteAsync
member.summary: Completes the stream when all buffered messages have been sent, if there is enough space in the buffer. This method can only be successfully called once, and further messages cannot be written after it has been successfully called.
member.returns: null if this stream has already be completed, or if the buffer is full; otherwise a which will complete when the stream has finished being completed.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BufferedClientStreamWriter`1.WriteCompleteAsync
member.summary: Completes the stream when all buffered messages have been sent, if there is enough space in the buffer. This method can only be successfully called once, and further messages cannot be written after it has been successfully called.
member.exception: This stream has already be completed, or the buffer is full
member.returns: A which will complete when the stream has finished being completed.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings.Merge(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings)
member.summary: Merges the settings in with those in , with taking priority. If both arguments are null, the result is null. If one argument is null, the other argument is returned. Otherwise, a new object is created with a property-wise overlay. Any header mutations are combined, however: the mutation from the original is performed, then the mutation in the overlay.
member.param: Original settings. May be null.
Settings to overlay. May be null.
member.returns: A merged set of call settings.

member.returns: A new instance.

member.returns: A new instance, or null if is null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings.FromFieldMask(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a that will include a field mask in the request, to limit which fields are returned in the response.
member.remarks: The precise effect on the request is not guaranteed: it may be through a header or a side-channel, for example. Likewise the effect of combining multiple settings containing field masks is not specified.
member.param: The field mask for the request. Must not be null.
member.returns: A new instance.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for . All methods accept a null first parameter as valid unless stated otherwise.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.MergedWith(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings)
member.summary: This method merges the settings in with those in , with taking priority. If both arguments are null, the result is null. If one argument is null, the other argument is returned. Otherwise, a new object is created with a property-wise overlay, where null values do not override non-null values. Any header mutations are combined, however: the mutation from the original is performed, then the mutation in the overlay.
member.param: Original settings. May be null.
Settings to overlay. May be null.
member.returns: A merged set of call settings, or null if both parameters are null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.WithCancellationToken(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns a new with the specified cancellation token, merged with the (optional) original settings specified by .
member.param: Original settings. May be null, in which case the returned settings will only contain the cancellation token.
Cancellation token for the new call settings.
member.returns: A new set of call settings.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.WithCallCredentials(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,Grpc.Core.CallCredentials)
member.summary: Returns a new with the specified call credentials, merged with the (optional) original settings specified by .
member.param: Original settings. May be null, in which case the returned settings will only contain call credentials.
Call credentials for the new call settings. This may be null, in which case any call credentials in are not present in the new call settings. If both this and are null, the return value is null.
member.returns: A new set of call settings, or null if both parameters are null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.WithCallTiming(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallTiming)
member.summary: Returns a new with the specified call timing, merged with the (optional) original settings specified by .
member.param: Original settings. May be null, in which case the returned settings will only contain call timing.
Call timing for the new call settings. This may be null, in which case any call timing in are not present in the new call settings. If both this and are null, the return value is null.
member.returns: A new set of call settings, or null if both parameters are null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.WithHeader(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a new with the specified header, merged with the (optional) original settings specified by .
member.param: Original settings. May be null, in which case the returned settings will only contain the header.
Header name. Must not be null.
Header value. Must not be null.
member.returns: A new set of call settings including the specified header.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.WithEarlierDeadline(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},Google.Api.Gax.IClock)
member.summary: Returns a which will have an effective deadline of at least . If already observes an earlier deadline (with respect to ), or if is null, the original settings will be returned.
member.param: Existing settings. May be null, meaning there are currently no settings.
Deadline to enforce. May be null, meaning there is no deadline to enforce.
The clock to use when computing deadlines. Must not be null.
member.returns: The call settings to use to observe the given deadline.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.WithExpiration(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Expiration)
member.summary: Returns a new with the given the expiration, merged with the (optional) original settings specified by .
member.remarks: If is non-null and has retry-based timing, the returned settings will have the same timing, but with the specified expiration. Otherwise, the returned settings will have a simple expiration.
member.param: Existing settings. May be null, meaning there are currently no settings.
Expiration to use in the returned settings, possibly as part of a retry. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettingsExtensions.ToCallOptions(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.CallSettings,Google.Api.Gax.IClock)
member.summary: Transfers settings contained in this into a .
member.param: The call settings for the call. May be null.
The clock to use for deadline calculation.
member.returns: A configured from this .

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ChannelPool
member.summary: A pool of channels for the same service, but with potentially different endpoints. Each endpoint has a single channel. All channels created by this pool use default application credentials. This class is thread-safe.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ChannelPool._lazyScopedDefaultChannelCredentials
member.summary: Lazily-created task to retrieve the default application channel credentials. Once completed, this task can be used whenever channel credentials are required. The returned task always runs in the thread pool, so its result can be used synchronously from synchronous methods without risk of deadlock. The same channel credentials are used by all pools. The field is initialized in the constructor, as it uses _scopes, and you can't refer to an instance field within an instance field initializer.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ChannelPool.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a channel pool which will apply the specified scopes to the default application credentials if they require any.
member.param: The scopes to apply. Must not be null, and must not contain null references. May be empty.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ChannelPool.ShutdownChannelsAsync
member.summary: Shuts down all the currently-allocated channels asynchronously. This does not prevent the channel pool from being used later on, but the currently-allocated channels will not be reused.
member.returns: A task which will complete when all the (current) channels have been shut down.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ChannelPool.GetChannel(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint)
member.summary: Returns a channel from this pool, creating a new one if there is no channel already associated with .
member.param: The endpoint to connect to. Must not be null.
member.returns: A channel for the specified endpoint.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ChannelPool.GetChannelAsync(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint)
member.summary: Asynchronously returns a channel from this pool, creating a new one if there is no channel already associated with .
member.param: The endpoint to connect to. Must not be null.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The value of the completed task will be channel for the specified endpoint.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ClientHelper.Clock
member.summary: The clock used for timing of retries and deadlines. This is never null; if the clock isn't specified in the settings, this property will return the instance.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ClientHelper.Scheduler
member.summary: The scheduler used for delays of retries. This is never null; if the scheduler isn't specified in the settings, this property will return the instance.

member.returns: A instance, populated most suitably for the given platform.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings
member.summary: Settings for retrying RPCs.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.RetryBackoff
member.summary: The backoff policy for the time between retries. This is never null.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.TimeoutBackoff
member.summary: The backoff policy for timeouts of retries. This is never null.
member.remarks: This allows an increasing timeout, initially requesting a fast call, then allowing a bit more time, then a bit more, and so on. However, the timeout will also be adjusted to accommodate .

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.TotalExpiration
member.summary: The total expiration, across all retries. This is never null.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.RetryFilter
member.summary: A predicate to determine whether or not a particular exception should cause the operation to be retried. Usually this is simply a matter of checking the status codes.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.DelayJitter
member.summary: The delay jitter to apply for delays, defaulting to .
member.remarks: "Jitter" is used to introduce randomness into the pattern of delays. This is to avoid multiple clients performing the same delay pattern starting at the same point in time, leading to higher-than-necessary contention. The default jitter simply takes each maximum delay and returns an actual delay which is a uniformly random value between 0 and the maximum. This is good enough for most applications, but makes precise testing difficult.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.#ctor(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Expiration)
member.summary: Constructs an instance with the given backoff configuration, the default RPC filter and jitter.
member.param: The backoff policy for the time between retries. Must not be null.
The backoff policy for timeouts of retries. Must not be null.
The total expiration, across all retries. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.#ctor(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Expiration,System.Predicate{Grpc.Core.RpcException})
member.summary: Constructs an instance with the given configuration, and the default jitter.
member.param: The backoff policy for the time between retries. Must not be null.
The backoff policy for timeouts of retries. Must not be null.
The total expiration, across all retries. Must not be null.
A predicate to determine whether or not a particular exception should cause the operation to be retried, or null for the default filter.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.#ctor(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.BackoffSettings,Google.Api.Gax.Expiration,System.Predicate{Grpc.Core.RpcException},Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.IJitter)
member.summary: Constructs an instance with the given configuration.
member.param: The backoff policy for the time between retries. Must not be null.
The backoff policy for timeouts of retries. Must not be null.
The total expiration, across all retries. Must not be null.
A predicate to determine whether or not a particular exception should cause the operation to be retried, or null for the default filter.
The delay jitter to apply for delays, or null for the defautl (random) jitter.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.IJitter
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for applying jitter to delays between retries. See the property for more information.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.IJitter.GetDelay(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns the actual delay to use given a maximum available delay.
member.param: The maximum delay provided by the backoff settings
member.returns: The delay to use before retrying.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.RandomJitter
member.summary: The default jitter which returns a uniformly distributed random delay between 0 and the specified maximum.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.NoJitter
member.summary: A jitter which simply returns the specified maximum delay.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.DefaultFilter
member.summary: The default retry filter, which retries operations which fail due to a status code of "not found".

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.FilterForStatusCodes(Grpc.Core.StatusCode[])
member.summary: Creates a retry filter based on status codes.
member.param: The status codes to retry. Must not be null.
member.returns: A retry filter based on status codes.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.FilterForStatusCodes(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Grpc.Core.StatusCode})
member.summary: Creates a retry filter based on status codes.
member.param: The status codes to retry. Must not be null.
member.returns: A retry filter based on status codes.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.RetrySettings.WithTotalExpiration(Google.Api.Gax.Expiration)
member.summary: Builds a new RetrySettings which is identical to this one, but with the given expiration.
member.param: New expiration

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint
member.summary: Settings specifying a service endpoint in the form of a host name and port. This class is immutable and thread-safe.

member.summary: The host name to connect to. Never null or empty.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint.Port
member.summary: The port to connect to, in the range 1 to 65535 inclusive.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new endpoint with the given host and port.
member.param: The host name to connect to. Must not be null or empty.
The port to connect to, in the range 1 to 65535 inclusive.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint.WithHost(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new endpoint with the same port but the given host.
member.param: The host name to connect to. Must not be null or empty.
member.returns: A new endpoint with the current port and the specified host.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint.WithPort(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new endpoint with the same host but the given port.
member.param: The port to connect to, in the range 1 to 65535 inclusive.
member.returns: A new endpoint with the current host and the specified port.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceEndpoint.ToString
member.summary: Returns this endpoint's data in the format "host:port".
member.returns: This endpoint's data in the format "host:port".

member.summary: Determines equality between this object and .
member.param: The object to compare with this one.
member.returns: true if is a with the same host and port; false otherwise.

member.summary: Returns a hash code for this object, consistent with .

member.summary: Determines equality between this endpoint and .

member.name: T:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase
member.summary: Common settings for all services.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new service settings base object with a default version header, unset call settings and unset clock.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase.#ctor(Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase)
member.summary: Constructs a new service settings base object by cloning the settings from an existing one.
member.param: The existing settings object to clone settings from. Must not be null.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase.VersionHeaderBuilder
member.summary: A builder for x-goog-api-client version headers. Additional library versions can be appended via this property.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase.CallSettings
member.summary: If not null, that are applied to every RPC performed by the client. If null or unset, RPC default settings will be used for all settings.

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase.Clock
member.summary: If not null, the clock used to calculate RPC deadlines. If null or unset, the is used.
member.remarks: This is primarily only to be set for testing. In production code generally leave this unset to use the .

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase.Scheduler
member.summary: If not null, the scheduler used for delays between operations (e.g. for retry). If null or unset, the is used.
member.remarks: This is primarily only to be set for testing. In production code generally leave this unset to use the .

member.name: P:Google.Api.Gax.Grpc.ServiceSettingsBase.Interceptor
member.summary: An optional gRPC interceptor to perform arbitrary interception tasks (such as logging) on gRPC calls. Note that this property is not used by code generated before August 2nd 2018: only packages created on or after that date are aware of this property.
